hackathon-description-text: This is the official SB Hacks submissions turnin page! Be sure to visit the submissions section and upload your project before 9:00 AM on Sunday, April 24th!
hackathon-rules:
The rules here are dictated by each challenge that you apply for, but there is one general rule:
1) You cannot submit a codebase that you have worked on from before January 30th at 9:30 PM.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The team with the best overall hack will receive one XBox One, a Dell Venue tablet for each team member, and 3 $100 amazon giftcards.
$1000 VISA gift card and FLIR ONE imagers for each team member. View PDF for details:
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: FLIR Best Surf and Sun App

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Best PT1 Wi-Fi Integration: $1000 VISA gift card and a PT1 module for each
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: The GroupGets PureThermal 1 Wi-Fi Integration Challenge

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $500 VISA gift card and FLIR ONE imagers for each team member
View the Google Doc for details:

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: MLH - Best use of Amazon Web Services

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: 4 Domain.com Swag bags with Sparkfun Redboard
Github Octocat figurine for each team member.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=552 University Rd, Isla Vista, CA 93117, USA
hackathon-location-address: 552 University Rd, Isla Vista, CA 93117, USA
hackathon-description-header: SB Hacks is an event in which hundreds of talented programmers compete for 36 hours to make amazing projects. The projects are then judged by tech professionals from the industry and from academia.
